intro: Taraxacum calocephaloides, commonly known as the broad-headed dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant features a hairy stem and basal leaves that are lanceolate to ovate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and form a single composite head, followed by a spherical seed head that disperses seeds via the wind. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides.
